verses.text: 耶穌不定犯姦淫婦人的罪耶穌往橄欖山去。

words.note: Often used in 審判 (shěnpàn) 'to judge'

verses.text: 黎明的時候，他又到聖殿去，眾人都來到他那裡，他就坐下教導他們。

words.note: Used as a directional complement after 來 (lái)

verses.text: 經學家和法利賽人帶了一個行淫時被抓到的婦人來，叫她站在中間，

words.note: A verb-object compound, lit. 'to perform lust/lewdness'
Used adverbially here, 'at the time of'
A verb-complement construction, 'to catch successfully'

verses.text: 就對耶穌說：「先生，這婦人是正在犯姦淫的時候被抓到的。

words.note: A respectful form of address, often for teachers or men of status.
A verb-complement construction, 'to catch successfully'

words.definition: structural particle (forming a 是...的 sentence)
words.note: Used in 是...的 (shì...de) structure to emphasize time/manner.

verses.text: 摩西在律法上吩咐我們把這樣的婦人用石頭打死，你怎樣說呢？」

words.note: Forms the fixed phrase '在...上' meaning 'in terms of', 'according to'.

words.definition: to beat to death, stone to death
words.note: A verb-complement construction, 'to hit until dead'.

verses.text: 他們說這話是要試探耶穌，要找把柄來控告他。耶穌卻彎下身，用指頭在地上寫字。

words.note: Often implies malicious or deceptive testing in biblical context.
Figuratively, something to hold against someone.
Indicates purpose or direction towards an action.

verses.text: 他們不住地問耶穌，他就挺起身來，說：「你們中間誰是沒有罪的，他就可以先拿起石頭打她。」

words.note: Connects an adverbial phrase to a verb.
Indicates direction or result of an action.
Turns a phrase into a noun equivalent (e.g., 'one who is without sin').

verses.text: 於是又彎下身在地上寫字。
他們聽了這話，就從年老的開始，一個一個地都離開了，留下的只有耶穌和那個還站在那裡的婦人。

words.note: Turns adjective into a noun equivalent (e.g., 'the old ones').
Connects an adverbial phrase to a verb.
Indicates a completed action or change of state.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb (e.g., 'those who remained').
Connects a descriptive phrase to a noun.
Often used for 'married woman' or 'lady' in classical/biblical contexts.

verses.text: 耶穌挺起身來，問她：「婦人，他們在哪裡？沒有人定你的罪嗎？」

words.note: Indicates direction or result of an action.
Often used for 'married woman' or 'lady' in classical/biblical contexts.
Used at the end of a sentence to form a yes-no question.

verses.text: 她說：「主啊！沒有。」耶穌說：「我也不定你的罪。走吧，從現在起不要再犯罪了。」

words.note: A title for God or Jesus
Used with 從 to mean 'from now on'

verses.text: 耶穌是世界的光耶穌又對眾人說：「我是世界的光，跟從我的，必定不在黑暗裡走，卻要得著生命的光。」

words.note: Here, 'those who follow me'

verses.text: 法利賽人對他說：「你為自己作證，你的見證不是真實的。」

words.note: Used to form an adjectival phrase

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「即使我為自己作證，我的見證還是真實的，因為我知道我從哪裡來，往哪裡去，但你們卻不知道我從哪裡來，往哪裡去。

words.note: Used to form an adjectival phrase

verses.text: 你們按著外貌判斷人，我卻不判斷人。
即使我判斷人，我的判斷也是正確的，因為我不是獨自一人，而是差我來的父和我在一起。

words.note: Indicates the preceding phrase is an adjective modifying an implied noun or completes a '是...的' sentence structure.
An idiomatic phrase meaning 'alone' or 'by oneself'.
Often used to connect contrasting clauses.
Used to connect a modifying phrase to a noun, similar to 'who' or 'which'.
Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.

verses.text: 你們的律法上也寫著：『兩個人的見證才是真的。』

words.note: Refers to the Mosaic Law or commandments.
Often used with location nouns (e.g., paper, book, law) to mean 'in' or 'on'.
Indicates the preceding phrase is an adjective modifying an implied noun or completes a '是...的' sentence structure.

verses.text: 我為自己作證，差我來的父也為我作證。」

words.note: Used to connect a modifying phrase to a noun, similar to 'who' or 'which'.
Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.

verses.text: 他們問：「你的父在哪裡？」耶穌回答：「你們不認識我，也不認識我的父；如果你們認識我，也就認識我的父了。」

words.note: Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.
Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.
Often used with 如果 (if) to introduce the consequence.
Refers to God the Father in Christian theology.
Indicates a change of state, completion, or new situation.

verses.text: 這些話是耶穌在殿裡教導人的時候，在銀庫的院中說的。當時沒有人逮捕他，因為他的時候還沒有到。

words.note: Used to connect a modifying phrase to a noun, similar to 'who' or 'which'.
Refers to the temple treasury.
Part of the '是...的' construction, emphasizing the place or manner of an action (是 is omitted here).
Functions here as an adverbial phrase meaning 'not yet' or 'did not'.

verses.text: 不信基督的必在罪中死亡耶穌又對他們說：「我要去了，你們要尋找我，並且要在自己的罪中死亡；我去的地方，你們不能到。」

words.note: Often used with 在... (在罪中 = in sin)
Often used with 在... (在罪中 = in sin)

verses.text: 於是猶太人說：「他說『我去的地方，你們不能到』，難道他要自殺嗎？」

words.note: Refers to the Jewish people.
Used to ask rhetorical questions, implying doubt.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「你們是從地上來的，我是從天上來的；你們屬這世界，我卻不屬這世界，

words.note: Refers to the worldly system, often contrasted with the spiritual.
Refers to the worldly system, often contrasted with the spiritual.

verses.text: 所以我對你們說，你們要在自己的罪中死亡；你們若不信我就是『那一位』，就要在自己的罪中死亡。」

words.note: Often used with 在... (在罪中 = in sin)
A respectful or theological reference to 'the one' (e.g., I Am).
Often used with 在... (在罪中 = in sin)

verses.text: 他們就問：「你是誰？」耶穌說：「我不是從起初就告訴你們嗎？

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts referring to creation or foundational events.

verses.text: 關於你們，我有許多事要說，要判斷；但那差我來的是真實的，我從他那裡聽見的，就告訴世人。」

words.note: Often combined to mean 'there' or 'from that place/person'
V-C compound: 'hear and perceive'
Often refers to 'people in general' or 'the world' in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 他們不明白耶穌是對他們講論父的事。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 所以耶穌說：「你們舉起了人子以後，必定知道我就是『那一位』，並且知道我不憑著自己作甚麼事；我說的這些話，是照著父所教導我的。

words.note: V-C compound: 'lift and rise'
A title for Jesus in the Bible.
Emphasizes the singular, specific person.
Refers to God the Father in this context.
Indicates the passive agent or object of a verb.

verses.text: 那差我來的和我同在，他沒有留下我獨自一人，因為我常作他喜悅的事。」

words.note: Often used in religious context meaning 'God is with me'.
V-C compound: 'leave down'

verses.text: 耶穌說這些話的時候，就有許多人信了他。

words.note: Forms a temporal clause when combined with '時候'.

verses.text: 真理必使人自由於是耶穌對信了他的猶太人說：「你們若持守我的道，就真是我的門徒了；

words.note: Lit. 'true principle'.
Lit. 'from oneself' or 'self-sufficient freedom'.
Refers to Jesus' teachings or the Way of God.
Lit. 'gate follower'.

verses.text: 你們必定認識真理，真理必定使你們自由。」
他們說：「我們是亞伯拉罕的後裔，從來沒有被誰奴役過，你怎麼說『你們必得自由』呢？」
耶穌說：「我實實在在告訴你們，凡犯罪的都是罪的奴隸。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis, 'amen amen' in Greek.
Often introduces a general statement.

verses.text: 奴隸不能永遠住在家裡，唯有兒子才可以永遠住在家裡。
所以， 神的兒子若使你們自由，你們就真的得自由了。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: The space before 神 (God) indicates reverence in some Bible editions.
Modifies the following verb phrase, 'truly obtain freedom'.

verses.text: 我知道你們是亞伯拉罕的後裔；但你們想殺我，因為你們心裡不能容納我的道。

words.note: Refers to Jesus' teachings or message.

verses.text: 我所說的，是我在父那裡看見的；但你們所作的，卻是從你們的父那裡聽見的。」

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase when placed before a verb and followed by 的.
Refers to God the Father.
Refers to their spiritual father, implied to be the devil (cf. John 8:44).

verses.text: 魔鬼的兒女不肯聽主的道他們說：「我們的祖宗是亞伯拉罕。」耶穌說：「你們若是亞伯拉罕的子孫，就必作亞伯拉罕所作的。
現在我把從 神那裡聽見的真理告訴了你們，你們竟然想殺我，這不是亞伯拉罕所作的。

words.note: The space before 神 (God) indicates reverence in some Bible editions.

verses.text: 你們要作的，正是你們的父要作的。」他們說：「我們不是從淫亂生的；我們只有一位父，就是 神。」

words.note: Refers to both earthly father and God.
Often refers to sexual immorality in the Bible.
Polite measure word for people.
Refers to God here.
The preceding space is a reverential mark for God in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「如果 神是你們的父，你們就必愛我，因為我是從 神那裡來的；我已經來到這裡。我不是憑著自己來的，而是 神差了我來。

words.note: Refers to God here.

verses.text: 你們為甚麼不明白我的話呢？因為我的道你們聽不進去。

words.note: Can refer to the Gospel or truth taught by Jesus.
A resultative verb compound, 'listen but cannot enter (the mind).'

verses.text: 你們是出於你們的父魔鬼，喜歡按著你們的父的私慾行事。他從起初就是殺人的兇手，不守真理，因為他心裡沒有真理。他說謊是出於本性，因為他本來就是說謊者，也是說謊的人的父。

words.note: Refers to the devil here.
Common term for Satan in Chinese Bible.
Refers to corrupt or carnal desires.
Refers to the very beginning of time or creation.
Core concept in Christian theology.
Refers to the devil as the 'father' of liars.

verses.text: 我講真理，你們卻因此不信我。
你們中間有誰能指證我有罪呢？我既然講真理，你們為甚麼不信我呢？

words.note: To point out and verify with evidence.
A core theological concept in John's Gospel.
Refers to spiritual belief or faith in Jesus.

verses.text: 出於 神的，就聽 神的話；你們不聽，因為你們不是出於 神的。」

words.note: The leading space is a traditional Chinese Bible convention for God.

verses.text: 亞伯拉罕以前耶穌已存在猶太人對耶穌說：「我們說你是撒瑪利亞人，並且是鬼附的，不是很對嗎？」
耶穌回答：「我不是鬼附的。我尊敬我的父，你們卻侮辱我。

words.note: Refers to God the Father in this context.

verses.text: 我不求自己的榮耀，但有一位是為我求榮耀，並且是審判人的。

words.note: Here, '審判人的' means 'one who judges people'.

verses.text: 我實實在在告訴你們，人若遵守我的道，必定永遠不見死亡。」

words.note: A solemn declaration, often used by Jesus.
More formal than '如果'.
Refers to Christ's teaching or the divine way.
Here, 'experience' or 'undergo'.

verses.text: 猶太人對他說：「現在我們知道你的確是鬼附的。亞伯拉罕死了，先知們也死了，你還說『人若遵守我的道，必定永遠不嘗死味』，

words.note: A verb-object compound functioning adjectivally.
Forms a descriptive phrase.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
More formal than '如果'.
Refers to Christ's teaching or the divine way.

verses.text: 難道你比我們的祖宗亞伯拉罕還大嗎？他死了，先知們也死了；你把自己當作甚麼人呢？」

words.note: Used to express rhetorical questions implying disbelief.
Lit. 'one who knows first'.
Marks the object before the verb.
Expresses a question, often with a rhetorical nuance.

verses.text: 耶穌回答：「如果我榮耀自己，我的榮耀就算不得甚麼；那使我得榮耀的是我的父，就是你們說是你們的 神的那一位。

words.note: Can be a verb 'glorify' or noun 'glory'.
Can be a verb 'glorify' or noun 'glory'.
An idiomatic expression meaning 'not count for anything'.
Can be a verb 'glorify' or noun 'glory'.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase.
Refers to God the Father.
Connects descriptive phrase to '那一位'.

verses.text: 可是你們不認識他，我卻認識他。如果我說我不認識他，我就像你們一樣是說謊的；然而我認識他，也遵守他的道。

words.note: Indicates a contrast or unexpected turn.
A verb-object compound functioning as a verb.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '說謊'.
More formal than '但是' (but).
Refers to Christ's teaching or the divine way.

verses.text: 你們的祖宗亞伯拉罕，因為可以看見我的日子就歡喜，既然看見了，他就很快樂。」
猶太人對他說：「你還不到五十歲，怎會見過亞伯拉罕呢？」

words.note: Refers to the people of Judea, often in religious or ethnic sense.

verses.text: 耶穌說：「我實實在在告訴你們，亞伯拉罕出生以前，我已經存在了。」

words.note: Repetition emphasizes sincerity or truthfulness, common in biblical speech.

verses.text: 於是他們拿起石頭要打他。耶穌卻躲起來，從殿裡出去了。

words.note: Refers to the Jerusalem Temple in this biblical context.
